result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley J. Schmitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  Restitution to be determined (DA to provide supplement within 10 days)  Maintain full-time employment  Pay child support as requested.  Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the agent.  Granted 36 days credit if probation revoked.

timeConds.notes:
Huber granted. Report clean & sober. May serve in Waushara County.
3-10-17 Court stays conditional jail sentence to be temporarily suspended as of today. Defendant may be released today. The remainder of the jail sentence to be served within his time on probation, contact jail to determine number of days he needs to serve. Conditions of stayed jail sentence: Defendant is to remain current on child support payments and make payments towards arrears.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley J. Schmitz

records.addlTxt: paid in full as reported by PP
Extending Probation

01:32 PM Defendant Bradley J. Schmitz appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Also appearing is Rebekka Johansen, agent.  Also appearing is Pam Dishman from CSA.
Court reviews file.  Ms. Dishman states there was only 1 payment in May.  States arrearage.
BY THE COURT:  Court finds defendant has not made a good faith effort and will extend for an additional 12 months.  If child support is caught up by next year, Court will waive all court costs and fees.  Court advises of potential jail time.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.
Probation review hearing scheduled
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: to Extend Probation

03:11 PM Defendant Bradley J. Schmitz appeared by video means. Agent Johansen also appears by video.
19CF35, 16CF12 & 14CF7 tracking together:
Defendant states that he will pay everything off with his back taxes.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant is working now and thought it was being paid through his employer but it wasn't.  Mr. Schmitz states that court costs will be paid through his employer not taxes.  Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court finds that good faith effort has not been made; Probation will be extended for 1 year.  If the costs are paid in full before that year is up; the court may terminate probation earlier.  If it is not paid off in a year, the court will extend probation with added conditions.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.
Agent Johansen will submit the paperwork
Zoom Information
Probation review hearing on June 2, 2020 at 03:00 pm.

for Unpaid Court Obligations

01:30 PM Defendant Bradley J. Schmitz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also appearing is Agent Rebecca Johanson.
Court notes issues at hand.  Defendant makes statement. Court questions defendant. Defendant states he has not paid all of his fines. States he is currently serving his jail time.  Requests deadline to serve jail to 2020.  Wishes to continue working to support everyone who is depending on him.  Atty Hendee responds states he doesn't take a position as to the extension, just believes the conditions jail time needs to be served.  Defendant makes further statement.  Agent makes statement.  
BY THE COURT:  Court finds defendant has not made a good faith effort to pay off the costs.  Court will extend probation due to that.  Defendant is to continue serving his sentence.  Huber will be granted.  Court will extend for 1 year but it may be discharged early if all conditions are met prior to that.

BY THE COURT:  Court notes there was no formal motion filed with the Court.  The defendant has given this Court no reason to reconsider his sentence.  The request is denied at this time.

records.addlTxt:
Restitution Hearing 3-10-17
Reporter Karen Blair
Child Support printout

Defendant Bradley J. Schmitz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CF12 & 14CF7 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that Atty Henney had originally been representing the defendant however, at the last hearing Atty Henney was allowed to withdraw.  Atty Hendee gives a brief summation of what today's hearing is regarding.  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with the defendant before court, the defendant is not objecting to the restitution request and then the State is in agreement to not object to the defendant's motion for the stay of the jail sentence and to be served within the 3 years.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney. Defendant understands.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney.    Court finds waiver of Attorney made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

Atty Hendee submits documentation of child support showing the balance to the court.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant understands.

BY THE COURT:  Court stays the conditional jail sentence to be temporarily suspended as of today.  The defendant will have to serve the remainder of the jail sentence within his time on Probation.; defendant is to contact the jail to find out how many more days he needs to serve.  All conditions of Probation will remain in affect.  Conditions of the stayed jail sentence:  Defendant is to remain current on child support payments and make payments towards arrears.
Defendant may be released today.
- filed by David Briant

of David Briant
Motion hearing on October 25, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Bradley J. Schmitz in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states that the hearing also involves 14CF12 and states matters before Court, Defendant having previously plead to Ct 1 in 14CF7 and Counts 1 & 2 in 16CF12. DA states that matters before the Court are relating to both prior cases and Restitution that the Order had been signed on.  Atty Henney states that a letter and Affidavit had been submitted by Defendant to the Clerk stating his contesting the $27,177.95 that the Court previously signed the Order on.  Requests reopen and reconsider amount of restitution owed by Defendant.  Atty Henney seeks additional time to review all of the paperwork as he cannot currently address any of the issues. Atty Hendee says it makes sense to continue the matter so he can provide paperwork to Atty Henney of CS Records, and requests the Defendant provide a statement of what the issues are that he has so all does not have to be reviewed.  Defendant also requested jail sentence be stayed to allow him time to spend his daughter's birthday with her.  Asked to be allowed to report on the 18th.  DA ovjected Judge denied request.  Defendant to report as previously ordered.  BTC: Defendant to report to jail as previously ordered.  Next Court Date is to be 10-25-16 @ 1:15 PM  Statement from Defendant to be filed with the Court by 10-15-16 end of day.

Motion hearing on September 13, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Bradley J. Schmitz in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Defendant Bradley J. Schmitz in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CF12 & 14CF7 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that he has met with the defendant in the jail to have a pre-trial and an offer was provided.  In speaking with Atty Henney; the matters are resolved.  Atty Hendee states that the Prelim needs to be waived in 16CF12.  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 in 14CF7 and Counts 1 & 2 in 16CF12.  Counts 2 & 3 in 14CF7 and Counts 3 & 4 in 16CF12 to be dismissed and read-in.

  Atty Henney states the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today on 16CF12 and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Henney states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Atty Henney enters a No Contest plea to Counts 1 & 2 in the information on 16CF12 and Ct. 1 in 14CF7.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 14CF7 and Counts 1 & 2 in 16CF12.  Counts 2 & 3 in 14CF7 and Counts 3 & 4 in 16CF12 to be dismissed and read-in.

Both parties are not requesting a PSI.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.  Atty Hendee asks for some time to get a Restitution Supplement to the Court.
Atty Henney makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  14CF7, Count 1 & 16CF12, Counts 1 & 2:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions:
9 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber  as to 14CF7 Ct 1
  Report on or before September 16, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Credit = 36 days (if revoked)
May serve in Waushara County 
Court Costs = $268.00 on each of the three counts  (changed Ct 1 on 14CF7 to costs of $112 as that was the amount for 2009 offense date)
DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge on each of the three counts
Restitution (Court gives the State 10 days to provide a Restitution Supplement)
Maintain full-time employment
Pay Child Support as requested
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent

Counts 2 & 3 in 14CF7 and Counts 3 & 4 in 16CF12 to be dismissed and read-in.
No PSI requested
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Request denied s/BNB/6-21-16
to Court from defendant

Atty Hendee states that the defendant appears in court today due to the warrant for non-appearance for the final pre-trial conference on January 8th.

Court questions the defendant.  Court verifies the address.  Mr. Schmitz states that the address was just changed yesterday; he apologizes for not keeping the court current with that.
Court questions the defendant regarding bond. Defendant is not sure.  Court will allow the defendant to continue today without an Attorney.
Atty Hendee will leave it up to the court.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant states that his mother has made some payments.  Defendant cannot make any payment today.  Atty Hendee states that the CSA has informed him when the last payment was made.  

BY THE COURT:  Court will set a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
